text.__SUMMARY__:
== Taxonomy ==
Boletus viscidocorrugis is a fungus of the genus Boletus native to North America. It was described scientifically by Ernst Both in 1998.
text.Description: Cap slimy, very wrinkled, orange-brown; pore surface white to pale yellow becoming olive, not bruising; stem whitish to brownish, with white scabers that do not darken in age; flesh white, staining pink on exposure; cap bright red with ammonia; spores 14-19 µ long; found on ground under oak Quercus rubraand among or on decayed leaves; known only from western New York.
